pr_title: Use next link from group membership request

timeline.message:
Use next link from group membership request

loadUser only gets the first 100 groups a user belongs to rather than
using the odata.nextLink in the response to get the full list of groups.
Fix this by checking if the response contains an odata.nextLink and then
build the URL appropriately for the configured API version.

For V1, odata.nextLink contains a skip token which we extract. More
information here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/azure/ad/graph/api/users-operations#get-a-users-manager--

For V2, odata.nextLink can be used directly as the URL for the request
as specified here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/paging

fix #14222

timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: It is being used now to properly build the url, depending on if the request is v1 or v2. see cc20c05
replies.author: ppartarr

timeline.body:
Is `Jdk8Module` is used for support `Optional` type in json?

Can we use null instead of `Optional`?
timeline.bodyText:
Is Jdk8Module is used for support Optional type in json?
Can we use null instead of Optional?
timeline.bodyHTML:
Is Jdk8Module is used for support Optional type in json?

Can we use null instead of Optional?
timeline.author: chenrujun

timeline.body:
I debugged in my localhost, `groupsFromJson.getOdataNextLink()` will return `null`, not `Optional.empty()`, so `groupsFromJson.getOdataNextLink().isPresent()` will throw `NullPointerExceotion`.

Json:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13167207/91273539-fee5fd80-e7af-11ea-967a-edefd156b7ba.png)

Screenshot of IDE:
![2020-08-26 152522](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13167207/91273988-9fd4b880-e7b0-11ea-856b-0656795ac355.png)

timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: thanks for the debugging. The change from Optional<String>  to String means that getOdataNextLink() now returns a string or null if there is no odata.nextLink in the response. I replaced isPresent() with a null check in cc20c05
replies.author: ppartarr

timeline.body: Please update java doc in line 147.
timeline.bodyText: Please update java doc in line 147.
timeline.bodyHTML: Please update java doc in line 147.
timeline.author: chenrujun

timeline.body: When will `id` and `objectType` been used? In the json I get, it only have `objectId` and `odata.type`.
timeline.bodyText: When will id and objectType been used? In the json I get, it only have objectId and odata.type.
timeline.bodyHTML: When will id and objectType been used? In the json I get, it only have objectId and odata.type.
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText:
id and objectType are used depending on if the request is to Azure AD Graph API (v1) or the Microsoft Graph API (v2). See example responses here: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/spring/azure-spring-boot/src/test/resources/aad
For reference, here are the docs for the /memberOf request/response for both versions:
Azure Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/azure/ad/graph/api/users-operations#get-a-users-group-and-directory-role-memberships--
Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/user-list-memberof?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=http
replies.author: ppartarr

timeline.body:
We can set default value to `Optional.empty()` to avoid `NullPointerException`.
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18805455/setting-default-values-to-null-fields-when-mapping-with-jackson

But `having an Optional in a class field or in a data structure, is considered a misuse of the API`,
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23454952/uses-for-optional

So I suggest to use
```
private String odataNextLink;
```
instead of 
```
private Optional<String> odataNextLink;
```
timeline.bodyText:
We can set default value to Optional.empty() to avoid NullPointerException.
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18805455/setting-default-values-to-null-fields-when-mapping-with-jackson
But having an Optional in a class field or in a data structure, is considered a misuse of the API,
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23454952/uses-for-optional
So I suggest to use
private String odataNextLink;

instead of
private Optional<String> odataNextLink;
timeline.bodyHTML:
We can set default value to Optional.empty() to avoid NullPointerException.
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18805455/setting-default-values-to-null-fields-when-mapping-with-jackson

But having an Optional in a class field or in a data structure, is considered a misuse of the API,
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23454952/uses-for-optional

So I suggest to use

private String odataNextLink;

instead of

private Optional<String> odataNextLink;
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing this out, using a String is the better approach! I made the change in cc20c05
replies.author: ppartarr
